message:
Further to this 👆

The Iranian news agency Fars claims that based on a preliminary investigation, it can be determined that Haniyeh was killed by a missile fired at the place where he was staying.
Fars does not specify whether it is a surface-to-air missile or whether it is a different missile, which means that Fars denies the bomb theory published yesterday by the New York Times and leaves the questions of "where was the missile fired from and what missile was it?" - open.
event_breakdown: The Iranian news agency Fars reports that the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) may have fired a ballistic missile at the residence of Haniyeh in Syria, resulting in his death.

message:
The Palestinians report that Nael al-Sakhl, a prisoner from Nablus who served a life sentence and was deported to Gaza as part of the Shalit deal, was killed in an IDF attack this morning in Gaza City.

Nael's father died inside the PA headquarters in Jnaid prison in Nablus in 2013 - Ismail Haniyeh called then to console...
Nael took an active part in the promotion of terrorism from within the Gaza Strip and, as can be seen in the attached photo, participated in the marches of return in the Gaza Strip on the border with Israel in previous years.
event_breakdown: New event: Nael al-Sakhl, a prisoner who was deported to Gaza as part of the Shalit deal, was killed in an IDF attack in Gaza City on June 5, 2023.

message:
The funeral ceremony of Haniyeh and his bodyguard in Qatar:
Khalil al-Hayya, Yahya Sinwar's deputy on the microphone.
Behind him, Ziyad al-Nakhalah, seecretary general of the Islamic Jihad, and Zaher Jabarin, senior leader in Hamas and responsible for their activity in the West Bank- both arrived on a flight from Tehran.
At the edge of the photo on the right - Abd Salam Haniyeh, Ismael Haniyeh's son and chairman of the Palestinian Sports Association of Gaza - who lives a comfortable life in Qatar (he left the Strip shortly before October 7).
event_breakdown: The most recent event found in the text is the funeral ceremony of Haniyeh and his bodyguard in Qatar. The funeral ceremony took place in Qatar.

message:
IDF: Over the past day (Friday), numerous rockets were identified crossing from the southern Gaza Strip into Israeli territory. No injuries were reported.

In response, the IAF struck and dismantled the launchers in the Gaza Strip from which the rockets were fired.

Following the sirens that sounded in the area of Nahal Oz, the IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted one projectile that crossed from the Gaza Strip. No injuries were reported.
event_breakdown:
IDF: Over the past day (Friday), numerous rockets were identified crossing from the southern Gaza Strip into Israeli territory. No injuries were reported.
IDF: In response to the rockets fired at Israeli territory, the IAF struck and dismantled the launchers in the Gaza strip.
IDF: Following the sirens that sounded in the area of Nahal Oz, the IDF Aerial Defense Array successfully intercepted one projectile that crossed from the Gaza Strip. No injuries were reported.

message: Further to this, the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (affiliated with Hezbollah) claims that the Syrian army launched two air defense missiles at Israeli fighter jets that attacked the airfield in the northeast of Qusayr - Hezbollah's stronghold in Syria.
event_breakdown: Israeli air strikes target Hezbollah positions in Syria, according to Hezbollah-affiliated newspaper Al-Akhbar. The location of the reported attack is Qusayr.

message:
IDF Spokesperson:

Following the alerts that were activated a short time ago in the Sufa region, eight projectiles were detected that crossed from the south of the Gaza Strip and fell in open areas, there were no casualties.
event_breakdown:
IDF Spokesperson:

On Tuesday, May 10, 2022, four rockets were launched from the Gaza Strip towards Israel. The rockets were intercepted by the Iron Dome missile defense system. There were no reports of injuries or damage as a result of the launches.

It was reported that there were no casualties.

message:
The Saudi daily Asharq Al-Awast: Israel killed two senior officials in the political bureau of Hamas and three senior officials in the military branch in Gaza

The newspaper reports from its sources that about a week and a half ago, Israel attacked a tunnel in the Sinaea area in the south of Gaza City (I will mention in this regard the IDF's activity about a week and a half ago in the Tel el Hawa area in the south of Gaza City -AA) in which a number of senior officials were killed.
According to the newspaper, these are the senior officials who were killed in the tunnel:

1. Rouhi Mushta, a member of the political bureau of Hamas, one of the senior members of Hamas in the Gaza Strip and a (very) close friend of Yahya Sinwar (they shared a cell together in an Israeli prison and were released together in the Shalit deal).

2. Samah a-Seraj, a member of the political bureau of Hamas.

3. Abd al-Hadi Siam - the military intelligence officer of the Gaza City Brigade and a senior commander in Nukhba.

4. Sami Odej, one of the commanders of the general security apparatus of the political echelon in Hamas.

5. Muhammad Hadid - one of the commanders of the rocket unit of the Gaza City Brigade in Hamas.


According to the newspaper, the tunnel was attacked at the beginning of the war, but was only partially damaged, so a number of senior officials returned to stay there.
The information reached the newspaper from sources in Hamas after some operatives of the military arm of Hamas went down to the tunnel to check if there were any survivors left.

##
This is another impressive achievement.
The Political Bureau of Hamas has become a small office. Its people are dwindling.
event_breakdown: Event: On May 14th 2021, IDF attacked a tunnel operated by Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) in Tel el Hawa area, south of Gaza City.A group of PIJ fighters staying in the tunnel at the time were killed.Tel el Hawa area, south of Gaza City.

event_breakdown:
Target Event: The Dutch Counterterrorism Agency raised its threat level to 'substantial' after several intelligence agencies warned of a potential terrorist attack in The Netherlands.
Location: The Netherlands
Details:
The threat level was raised on Thursday, and security was increased at airports, train stations, and other public places. The increased threat level comes just days after a car attack in London that killed four people.
The Dutch Counterterrorism Agency raised its threat level to 'substantial' on Wednesday after several intelligence agencies warned of a potential terrorist attack in The Netherlands. The threat level was increased on Wednesday, and security was increased at airports, train stations, and other public places. The increased threat level comes just days after a car attack in London that killed four people.
The Dutch intelligence agency has not released any further information about the potential threat or any specific locations where an attack might occur.

message: The inciting sheikh Ekrima Sabri was taken into questioning after eulogizing Haniyeh.
event_breakdown:
Target Event: Inciting Sheikh Ekrima Sabri Taken into Questioning

Relevant Current Events:

1. Sheikh Ekrima Sabri Taken into Questioning: Sheikh Ekrima Sabri, a prominent Palestinian cleric and former imam of the Al-Aqsa Mosque, was taken into questioning by Israeli police after praising the recent re-election of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh at a ceremony in Jerusalem. The Israeli authorities accuse Sabri of "incITEMOgnatiON and promoting violence".
2. Jerusalem Clashes: Ongoing clashes between Palestinian demonstrators and Israeli security forces in Jerusalem following the incident involving Sheikh Ekrima Sabri. The clashes have resulted in the injuries of several protesters and Israeli police officers.
3. Palestinian Authority Protests: The Palestinian Authority has condemned Israel's actions, with President Mahmoud Abbas denouncing "the Israeli attempts to intimidate Al-Mustafa and silence the legitimate voice of the Palestinian people."
4. Jerusalem Violence: The events in Jerusalem are the latest in a string of recent violent incidents in the city. Over the past few weeks, there have been several stabbing and car-ramming attacks by Palestinians against Israeli civilians and security personnel.
5. the Temple Mount: A contentious holy site in Jerusalem's Old City, known to Jews as the Temple Mount and to Muslims as the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound. The site has been a frequent flashpoint for Israeli-Palestinian tension and violence.
